Class GameManager

extends Object

      GameManager(PlayerManager playMan)
      The GameManager is a storage of the currently playing games.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameManager

        public GameManager(PlayerManager playMan)
        The GameManager is a storage of the currently playing games. It is connected with the clients via Lists, which are to be maintained by the Server class.
        Parameters:
        toRemoveClientId - The toRemoveClientId of the player

    • Method Detail

      • addToRequestQueue

        public void addToRequestQueue(ToServerPacket toServerPacket)
        A client who wants to join a game is added onto the request queue.
        Parameters:
        toServerPacket - the ToServerPacket of the player wanting to join.

      • removeFromRequestQueue

        public void removeFromRequestQueue(int toRemoveClientId)
        A client that needs to be removed from the requestQueue is removed here.
        Parameters:
        toRemoveClientId - The toRemoveClientId of the player

      • tryMoveFor

        public void tryMoveFor(int clientId,
                       int moveDataRow,
                       int moveDataCol)
        For a move specified of a player, the gameObj of the current game is grabbed afterwards the gameObj is invoked to do the move.
        Parameters:
        clientId - The clientId of the player which wants to pass

      • passFor

        public void passFor(int clientId)
        Accepts a pass, and determines with it if the game should end or not.
        Parameters:
        clientId - The clientId of the player which wants to pass

      • errorQuit2PGameFor

        public void errorQuit2PGameFor(int clientId)
        Error handling Quit Game function, in any occurence (for example socket error) a game and its players should be cleaned from it.
        Parameters:
        clientId - The clientId of the player

      • getGameObjForClient

        public GameObj getGameObjForClient(int clientId)
        Searches for any game a player is currently participating in.
        Parameters:
        clientId - The clientId of the player
        Returns:
        gameObj The gameObj in which the player is in.

      • quit2PGameFor

        public void quit2PGameFor(int clientId)
        The method searches for any games (as player 1 or player 2) the clientId is participating in. It subsequently searches a game, then removes it from the 'memory' list. Afterwards the players are unset of their ingame status and informed about the quit.
        Parameters:
        clientId - The clientId of the player
        See Also:
        server.Server.playerIsInGameServlet(), passFor();

      • new2PGame

        public void new2PGame(ToServerPacket packetP1,
                      ToServerPacket packetP2)
        The method creates a new GameObject and assigns two players. The players are removed after assignment from the requestQueue. An unique game-id is assigned to the created game, the counter is held in this.gameId.
        Parameters:
        packetP1 - ToServerPacket which contains the game request
        packetP2 - ToServerPacket which contains the game request
        See Also:
        processRequestQueue();

      • processRequestQueue

        public void processRequestQueue()
        Processing of the request queue occurs here. The list requestQueue is retained if the amount of players is not 2. When more players are enqueued, they are assigned a game based first in first out. If a player is assigned not assigned a game a message is sent to the client via the message queue txQueue, the message queue of GameManager.
        Parameters:
        -
        See Also:
        txQueue.add(), new2PGame();

      • getTxQueue

        public List<ToClientPacket> getTxQueue()
        Getter for txQueue.
        Returns:
        txQueue List

      • clearTxQueue

        public void clearTxQueue()
        Clears txQueue list.
